meanings.definition: To pledge or pawn something as security for a loan.
meanings.sent1: She impawns her necklace to borrow money.
meanings.sent2: He impawns his watch at the pawn shop.
meanings.sent3: Impawning her ring, she got the cash she needed.
meanings.sent4: The idea of impawning his guitar for quick cash crossed his mind.
meanings.sent5: Impawning items can help in times of financial need.

meanings.definition: The act of pawning or pledging something as security.
meanings.sent1: His impawning of the family heirloom was a last resort.
meanings.sent2: The impawning of valuable items is common in times of need.
meanings.sent3: The impawning of the rare painting raised eyebrows at the auction.
meanings.sent4: Her impawning of the antique vase was a bold move.
meanings.sent5: The impawning process can be stressful but necessary.
